DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the 2nd location on or within the human body of infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_A position in relation to its surroundings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::2:Position in relation to the surroundings.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003_A position in relation to its surroundings._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

Concepts.definition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ located between the esophagus and the small intestine where digestion of food occurs before passing to the small intestine.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.|On-line Medical Dictionary

Concepts.definition: The elongated, approximately cylindrical part of the central nervous system of vertebrates that lies in the vertebral canal and from which the spinal nerves emerge.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys those that are aging. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach. (OCC)

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive tube between the stomach and the cecum or beginning of the large intestine; it consists of three portions: duodenum, jejunum, and ileum. SYN intestinum tenue.

Concepts.definition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the bone and its structures due to infection with pyogenic bacteria.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic inflammation of the bone and its structures due to infection with pyogenic bacteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Air-filled extensions of the respiratory part of the nasal cavity into the frontal, ethmoid, sphenoid, and maxillary cranial bones. They vary in size and form in different individuals and are lined by the ciliated mucous membranes of the nasal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The innermost layer of the heart, comprised of endothelial cells. (MeSH): The main substance of the muscular wall of the heart enclosed between the epicardium and endocardium and composed of striated, involuntary cardiac muscle. (MeSH): The fibroserous sac surrounding the heart and the roots of the great vessels.

Concepts.definition: The layer of endothelial cells and connective tissue lining the chambers of the heart.
The striated muscle tissue of the heart enveloped by the epicardium and the endocardium.
A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pustular Lesion Or Abscess Skin Rash

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pustular Lesion Or Abscess Skin Rash
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A circumscribed and elevated skin lesion filled with pus.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection.: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localised to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful

Concepts.definition: A circumscribed and elevated skin lesion filled with purulent material.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.

Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in males that surrounds the neck of the BLADDER and the URETHRA. It secretes a substance that liquifies coagulated semen. It is situated in the pelvic cavity behind the lower part of the PUBIC SYMPHYSIS, above the deep layer of the triangular ligament, and rests upon the RECTUM.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is abnormally collected in the pleural cavity.: The cavity lined by the pleura, located in the thorax and contains heart and lungs.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is ordinarily present in the pleural space. It allows for normal movement of the lungs during respiration.
The potential space between parietal and visceral pleurae. There is a separate pleural cavity for each lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-um) The tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, mesentery, and pelvic organs. It consists of the parietal peritoneum and the visceral peritoneum.

PermissibleValues.value: Central nervous system, not otherwise specified
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Otherwise Specified Central Nervous System

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Otherwise Specified Central Nervous System
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the two fleshy, full-blooded margins of the mouth. (MeSH)

Concepts.definition: Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The point of connection between two bones or elements of a skeleton, especially if the articulation allows motion.

Concepts.definition: The connection point between two bones or skeletal elements. The joint may be fixed or movable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the  initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area.

Concepts.definition: A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the patient's initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area.

PermissibleValues.value: Central venous catheter, not otherwise specified
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Otherwise Specified Central Venous Access Catheter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Otherwise Specified Central Venous Access Catheter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (fa-LO-pee-in) Part of the female reproductive tract. The long slender tubes through which eggs pass from the ovaries to the uterus.: The hollow muscular organ in which the impregnated ovum is developed into the child; it is about 7.5 cm in length in the nonpregnant woman, and consists of a main portion (body) with an elongated lower part (neck), at the extremity of which is the opening (os). The upper rounded portion of the uterus, opposite the os, is the fundus, at each extremity of which is the horn marking the part where the uterine tube joins the uterus and through which the ovum reaches the uterine cavity after leaving the ovary. The organ is supported in the pelvic cavity by the broad ligaments, round ligaments, cardinal ligaments, and rectouterine and vesicouterine folds or ligaments. SYN metra, womb.: (SER-viks) The lower, narrow end of the uterus that forms a canal between the uterus and vagina.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of tubes that extend from the uterus to each of the ovaries. Following ovulation the egg travels down the fallopian tube to the uterus where fertilization may or may not occur.
A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.
The lower part of the uterus occupying the region between the isthmus of the uterus and the vagina. It is divided into supravaginal and vaginal portions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition to use current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of hearing: composed of the external ear, which includes the auricle and the external acoustic, or auditory, meatus; the middle ear, or the tympanic cavity with its ossicles; and the internal ear or inner ear, or labyrinth, which includes the semicircular canals, vestibule, and cochlea. SEE ALSO auricle. SYN auris.

Concepts.definition: A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance.

PermissibleValues.value: Gallbladder and biliary tree (not hepatitis), pancreas

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pear-shaped organ just below the liver that stores the bile secreted by the liver, delivering the bile through the bile ducts into the intestines to help with digestion.: The duct system that transports bile from its origination by hepatocytes in the liver to the small intestine. It is comprised of the common bile duct that connects the liver and gall bladder to the small intestine and the cystic duct that connects the gall bladder to the common bile duct.: A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

Concepts.definition: A pear-shaped organ located under the liver that stores and concentrates bile secreted by the liver. From the gallbladder the bile is delivered through the bile ducts into the intestine thereby aiding the digestion of fat-containing foods.

The system that transports bile from the hepatocytes in the liver to the small intestine. It is comprised of the intrahepatic bile ducts, hepatic ducts, common bile duct, cystic duct, and the gallbladder.

An organ behind the lower part of the stomach that is the shape of a fish and about the size of a hand. It is a compound gland composed of both exocrine and endocrine tissues. The endocrine pancreas makes insulin so that the body can use glucose (sugar) for energy. The exocrine pancreas makes enzymes that help the body digest food. Spread all over the pancreas are areas called the Islets of Langerhans. The cells in these areas each have a special purpose. The alpha cells make glucagon, which raises the level of glucose in the blood; the beta cells make insulin; the delta cells make somatostatin. There are also PP cells and D1 cells, about which little is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute, spreading infection of the deep tissues of the skin and muscle that causes the skin to become warm and tender and may also cause fever, chills, swollen lymph nodes, and blisters.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is administered.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

Concepts.definition: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is administered.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.: The extreme end of something, especially something pointed.

Concepts.definition: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.
The extreme end of something, especially something pointed.

PermissibleValues.value: Disseminated - generalized, isolated at 3 or more distinct sites
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Isolation Greater Than or Equal To Integer::3 Anatomic Site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Isolation Greater Than or Equal To Integer::3 Anatomic Site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part.::3: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Named locations of or within the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Kidneys, renal pelvis, ureters and bladder
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Kidney Renal Pelvis Ureter And Bladder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Kidney Renal Pelvis Ureter And Bladder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two organs that excrete the urine. The kidneys are bean-shaped organs (about 11 cm long, 5 cm wide, and 3 cm thick) lying on either side of the vertebral column, posterior to the peritoneum, about opposite the twelfth thoracic and first three lumbar vertebrae. SYN ren, nephros.: The area at the center of the kidney. Urine collects here and is funneled into the ureter, the tube that connects the kidney to the bladder.: (yoo-REE-ter) The tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.
The funnel-shaped proximal portion of the ureter located within the kidney into which urine is secreted, from the collecting duct system of the kidney.
The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic, bacterial or viral inflammatory process affecting the larynx. Symptoms include sore throat, cough, swallowing difficulties, and hoarseness.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options: The organ of voice production; the part of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea; it consists of a framework of cartilages and elastic membranes housing the vocal folds and the muscles which control the position and tension of these elements.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic, bacterial or viral inflammatory process affecting the larynx. Signs and symptoms include sore throat, cough, swallowing difficulties, and hoarseness.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.

PermissibleValues.value: Urine, kidneys, renal pelvis, ureters and bladder
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Urine Kidney Renal Pelvis Ureter And Bladder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Urine Kidney Renal Pelvis Ureter And Bladder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.: One of the two organs that excrete the urine. The kidneys are bean-shaped organs (about 11 cm long, 5 cm wide, and 3 cm thick) lying on either side of the vertebral column, posterior to the peritoneum, about opposite the twelfth thoracic and first three lumbar vertebrae. SYN ren, nephros.: The area at the center of the kidney. Urine collects here and is funneled into the ureter, the tube that connects the kidney to the bladder.: (yoo-REE-ter) The tube that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.
The funnel-shaped proximal portion of the ureter located within the kidney into which urine is secreted, from the collecting duct system of the kidney.
The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: The middle layer fraction of an anticoagulated blood sample that contains most of the white blood cells and platelets following density gradient centrifugation of the blood.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cartilaginous and membranous tube descending from the larynx and branching into the right and left main bronchi.: (BRONK-eye) The large air passages that lead from the trachea (windpipe) to the lungs.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.

Concepts.definition: The fibrocartilaginous, mucous-lined tube passing from the larynx to the bronchi.
Tubular structure in continuation with the trachea, serving as air passage. It terminates in the lung (terminal bronchiole).
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Muscle; one of the contractile organs of the body.

Concepts.definition: One of the contractile organs of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of three membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.

Concepts.definition: Any one of three membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: (or-o-FAIR-inks) The middle part of the throat that includes the soft palate, the base of the tongue, and the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: (RES-pih-ra-tor-ee) The organs that are involved in breathing. These include the nose, throat, larynx, trachea, bronchi, and lungs.Also known as the respiratory tract.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
The organs involved in the exchange of carbon dioxide and oxygen including the trachea, bronchi, and lung parenchyma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that flows in and around the hollow spaces of the brain and spinal cord, and between two of the meninges (the thin layers of tissue that cover and protect the brain and spinal cord). CSF is made by tissue called the choroid plexus in the ventricles (hollow spaces) in the brain.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.

The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.

Concepts.definition: The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recess, cavity, or channel.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: The sinuses and those parts of the respiratory system above the trachea. It includes the nares, nasopharynx, oropharynx, larynx, vocal cords, glottis and upper trachea.

Concepts.definition: A recess, cavity, or channel.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The sinuses and those parts of the respiratory system above the trachea. It includes the nares, nasopharynx, oropharynx, larynx, vocal cords, glottis and upper trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the jejunum and ileum of the small intestine and the large intestine.

Concepts.definition: The lower part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the jejunum and ileum of the small intestine and the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: Infection of the deep skin and subcutaneous tissues and necrosis of the fascia. It is caused by bacteria including group A streptococcus, Staphylococcus aureus and Clostridium perfringens. It may develop following trauma and invasive procedures.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Infection of the deep skin and subcutaneous tissues and necrosis of the fascia. It is caused by bacteria including group A streptococcus, Staphylococcus aureus and Clostridium perfringens. It may develop following trauma and invasive procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.: The organs involved in the creation and excretion of urine.

Concepts.definition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
The organs involved in the creation and excretion of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bottom one of two.: The organs involved in the creation and excretion of urine.

Concepts.definition: The bottom one of two.
The organs involved in the creation and excretion of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.

The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bottom one of two.: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: The bottom one of two.

The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:Position in relation to the surroundings.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
A position in relation to its surroundings.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
